trans-unit.source: Lets you efficiently bulk load a SQL Server table with data from another source.
Microsoft SQL Server includes a popular command-prompt utility named **bcp** for moving data from one table to another, whether on a single server or between servers.
The <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> class lets you write managed code solutions that provide similar functionality.
There are other ways to load data into a SQL Server table (INSERT statements, for example), but <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> offers a significant performance advantage over them.
The <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> class can be used to write data only to SQL Server tables.

However, the data source is not limited to SQL Server; any data source can be used, as long as the data can be loaded to a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> instance or read with a <xref:System.Data.IDataReader> instance.

<xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> will fail when bulk loading a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> column of type <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlDateTime> into a SQL Server column whose type is one of the date/time types added in SQL Server 2008.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> class using the specified open instance of <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection"></xref>.

Because the connection is already open when the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> instance is initialized, the connection remains open after the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> instance is closed.
If the `connection` argument is null, an <xref:System.ArgumentNullException> is thrown.
The already open <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection"></xref> instance that will be used to perform the bulk copy operation.

If your connection string does not use `Integrated Security = true`, you can use <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential"></xref> to pass the user ID and password more securely than by specifying the user ID and password as text in the connection string.
Initializes and opens a new instance of based on the supplied connectionString.
The constructor uses the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection"></xref> to initialize a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> class.
The connection is automatically closed at the end of the bulk copy operation.
If `connectionString` is null, an <xref:System.ArgumentNullException> is thrown.
If `connectionString` is an empty string, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown.
The string defining the connection that will be opened for use by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> instance.

If your connection string does not use `Integrated Security = true`, you can use <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.#ctor(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection)"></xref> or <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.#ctor(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction)"></xref> and <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential"></xref> to pass the user ID and password more securely than by specifying the user ID and password as text in the connection string.
Initializes and opens a new instance of based on the supplied connectionString.
The constructor uses that <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection"></xref> to initialize a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> class.
The instance behaves according to options supplied in the copyOptions parameter.
You can obtain detailed information about all the bulk copy options in the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions> topic.
The string defining the connection that will be opened for use by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> instance.

If your connection string does not use `Integrated Security = true`, you can use <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.#ctor(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection)"></xref> or <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.#ctor(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction)"></xref> and <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential"></xref> to pass the user ID and password more securely than by specifying the user ID and password as text in the connection string.
A combination of values from the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions"></xref> enumeration that determines which data source rows are copied to the destination table.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> class using the supplied existing open instance of <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection"></xref>.
The instance behaves according to options supplied in the copyOptions parameter.
If a non-null <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction"></xref> is supplied, the copy operations will be performed within that transaction.
If options include `UseInternalTransaction` and the `externalTransaction` argument is not null, an **InvalidArgumentException** is thrown.
For examples demonstrating how to use `SqlBulkCopy` in a transaction, see [Transaction and Bulk Copy Operations](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/transaction-and-bulk-copy-operations.md).
The already open <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection"></xref> instance that will be used to perform the bulk copy.

If your connection string does not use `Integrated Security = true`, you can use <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential"></xref> to pass the user ID and password more securely than by specifying the user ID and password as text in the connection string.
A combination of values from the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions"></xref> enumeration that determines which data source rows are copied to the destination table.
An existing <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction"></xref> instance under which the bulk copy will occur.
Number of rows in each batch.
At the end of each batch, the rows in the batch are sent to the server.
A batch is complete when <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.BatchSize%2A> rows have been processed or there are no more rows to send to the destination data source.
Zero (the default) indicates that each <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer%2A> operation is a single batch.

If the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> instance has been declared without the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions.UseInternalTransaction> option in effect, rows are sent to the server <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.BatchSize%2A> rows at a time, but no transaction-related action is taken.
If <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions.UseInternalTransaction> is in effect, each batch of rows is inserted as a separate transaction.
The <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.BatchSize%2A> property can be set at any time.
If a bulk copy is already in progress, the current batch is sized according to the previous batch size.
Subsequent batches use the new size.

If the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.BatchSize%2A> is initially zero and changed while a <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer%2A> operation is already in progress, that operation loads the data as a single batch.

Any subsequent <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer%2A> operations on the same <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> instance use the new <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.BatchSize%2A>.
The integer value of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.BatchSize"></xref> property, or zero if no value has been set.
Number of seconds for the operation to complete before it times out.
If the operation does time out, the transaction is not committed and all copied rows are removed from the destination table.
The integer value of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.BulkCopyTimeout"></xref> property.
The default is 30 seconds.
A value of 0 indicates no limit; the bulk copy will wait indefinitely.
Closes the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> instance.
After you call a <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.Close%2A> on the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> object, no other operation will succeed.
Calls to the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer%2A> method will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.

Calling the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.Close%2A> method from the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.SqlRowsCopied> event causes an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> to be thrown.
Note that open <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> instances are closed implicitly at the end of a `using` block.
Returns a collection of <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyColumnMapping"></xref> items.
Column mappings define the relationships between columns in the data source and columns in the destination.

If the data source and the destination table have the same number of columns, and the ordinal position of each source column within the data source matches the ordinal position of the corresponding destination column, the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.ColumnMappings%2A> collection is unnecessary.

However, if the column counts differ, or the ordinal positions are not consistent, you must use <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.ColumnMappings%2A> to make sure that data is copied into the correct columns.
During the execution of a bulk copy operation, this collection can be accessed, but it cannot be changed.
Any attempt to change it will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
A collection of column mappings.
By default, it is an empty collection.
Name of the destination table on the server.

If <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName%2A> has not been set when <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer%2A> is called, an <xref:System.ArgumentNullException> is thrown.

If <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName%2A> is modified while a <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer%2A> operation is running, the change does not affect the current operation.
The new <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName%2A> value is used the next time a <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer%2A> method is called.
<xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName%2A> is a three-part name (`<database>.<owningschema>.<name>`).
You can qualify the table name with its database and owning schema if you choose.
However, if the table name uses an underscore ("_") or any other special characters, you must escape the name using surrounding brackets as in (`[<database>.<owningschema>.<name_01>]`).
For more information, see "Identifiers" in SQL Server Books Online.
You can bulk-copy data to a temporary table by using a value such as `tempdb..#table` or `tempdb.<owner>.#table` for the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName%2A> property.
The string value of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property, or null if none as been supplied.
Enables or disables a <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object to stream data from an <xref href="System.Data.IDataReader"></xref> object

When <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.EnableStreaming%2A> is `true`, <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> reads from an <xref:System.Data.IDataReader> object using <xref:System.Data.CommandBehavior.SequentialAccess>, optimizing memory usage by using the <xref:System.Data.IDataReader> streaming capabilities.

When itâ€™s set to false, the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> class loads all the data returned by the <xref:System.Data.IDataReader> object into memory before sending it to [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] or SQL Azure.
`true` if a <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object can stream data from an <xref href="System.Data.IDataReader"></xref> object; otherwise, false.
The default is `false`.
Defines the number of rows to be processed before generating a notification event.
This property is designed for user interface components that illustrate the progress of a bulk copy operation.
It indicates the number of rows to be processed before generating a notification event.
The <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.NotifyAfter%2A> property can be set at any time, even while a bulk copy operation is underway.
Changes made during a bulk copy operation take effect after the next notification.
The new setting applies to all subsequent operations on the same instance.
If <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.NotifyAfter%2A> is set to a number less than zero, an <xref:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException> is thrown.
The integer value of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.NotifyAfter"></xref> property, or zero if the property has not been set.
Occurs every time that the number of rows specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.NotifyAfter"></xref> property have been processed.
Note that the settings of <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.NotifyAfter%2A> and <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.BatchSize%2A> are independent.
Receipt of a <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.SqlRowsCopied> event does not imply that any rows have been sent to the server or committed.
You cannot call SqlBulkCopy.Close (<xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.Close%2A>) or SqlConnection.Close (<xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection.Close%2A>) from this event.
Doing this will cause an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> being thrown, and the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> object state will not change.

If the user wants to cancel the operation from the event, the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlRowsCopiedEventArgs.Abort%2A> property of the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlRowsCopiedEventArgs> can be used.

(See [Transaction and Bulk Copy Operations](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/transaction-and-bulk-copy-operations.md) for examples that use the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlRowsCopiedEventArgs.Abort%2A> property.)

No action, such as transaction activity, is supported in the connection during the execution of the bulk copy operation, and it is recommended that you not use the same connection used during the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.SqlRowsCopied> event.
However, you can open a different connection.

Copies only rows that match the supplied row state in the supplied <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> to a destination table specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object.
Only rows in the <xref:System.Data.DataTable> that are in the states indicated in the `rowState` argument and have not been deleted are copied to the destination table.

If <xref:System.Data.DataRowState.Deleted> is specified, any <xref:System.Data.DataRowState.Unchanged>, <xref:System.Data.DataRowState.Added>, and <xref:System.Data.DataRowState.Modified> rows will also be copied to the server.
No exception will be raised.
While the bulk copy operation is in progress, the associated destination <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection> is busy serving it, and no other operations can be performed on the connection.
The <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.ColumnMappings%2A> collection maps from the <xref:System.Data.DataTable> columns to the destination database table.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> whose rows will be copied to the destination table.
A value from the <xref href="System.Data.DataRowState"></xref> enumeration.
Only rows matching the row state are copied to the destination.

Copies all rows in the supplied <xref href="System.Data.IDataReader"></xref> to a destination table specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object.
The copy operation starts at the next available row in the reader.
Most of the time, the reader was just returned by <xref:System.Data.IDbCommand.ExecuteReader%2A> or a similar call, so the next available row is the first row.
To process multiple results, call <xref:System.Data.IDataReader.NextResult%2A> on the data reader and call <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer%2A> again.
Note that using <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer%2A> modifies the state of the reader.
The method will call <xref:System.Data.IDataReader.Read%2A> until it returns false, the operation is aborted, or an error occurs.
This means that the data reader will be in a different state, probably at the end of the result set, when the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer%2A> operation is complete.
While the bulk copy operation is in progress, the associated destination <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection> is busy serving it, and no other operations can be performed on the connection.
The <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.ColumnMappings%2A> collection maps from the data reader columns to the destination database table.
A <xref href="System.Data.IDataReader"></xref> whose rows will be copied to the destination table.

Copies all rows in the supplied <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> to a destination table specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object.
All rows in the <xref:System.Data.DataTable> are copied to the destination table except those that have been deleted.
While the bulk copy operation is in progress, the associated destination <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection> is busy serving it, and no other operations can be performed on the connection.
The <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.ColumnMappings%2A> collection maps from the <xref:System.Data.DataTable> columns to the destination database table.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> whose rows will be copied to the destination table.

Copies all rows from the supplied <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbDataReader"></xref> array to a destination table specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbDataReader"></xref> whose rows will be copied to the destination table.

Copies all rows from the supplied <xref href="System.Data.DataRow"></xref> array to a destination table specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object.
While the bulk copy operation is in progress, the associated destination <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection> is busy serving it, and no other operations can be performed on the connection.
The <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.ColumnMappings%2A> collection maps from the <xref:System.Data.DataRow> columns to the destination database table.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataRow"></xref> objects that will be copied to the destination table.

The asynchronous version of <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.IDataReader)"></xref>, which copies all rows in the supplied <xref href="System.Data.IDataReader"></xref> to a destination table specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object.
The cancellation token can be used to request that the operation be abandoned before the command timeout elapses.
Exceptions will be reported via the returned Task object.

For more information about asynchronous programming in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] Data Provider for [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)], see [Asynchronous Programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md).
A <xref href="System.Data.IDataReader"></xref> whose rows will be copied to the destination table.
The cancellation instruction.

A <xref href="System.Threading.CancellationToken.None"></xref> value in this parameter makes this method equivalent to <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.DataTable)"></xref>.
A task representing the asynchronous operation.
Calling <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.IDataReader)"></xref> multiple times for the same instance before task completion.

Calling <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.IDataReader)"></xref> and <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.IDataReader)"></xref> for the same instance before task completion.
The connection drops or is closed during <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.IDataReader)"></xref> execution.
Returned in the task object, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object was closed during the method execution.
Returned in the task object, there was a connection pool timeout.
Returned in the task object, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection"></xref> object is closed before method execution.
The <xref href="System.Data.IDataReader"></xref> was closed before the completed <xref href="System.Threading.Tasks.Task"></xref> returned.
The <xref href="System.Data.IDataReader"></xref>'s associated connection was closed before the completed <xref href="System.Threading.Tasks.Task"></xref> returned.
`Context Connection=true` is specified in the connection string.
Returned in the task object, any error returned by [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] that occurred while opening the connection.

The asynchronous version of <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.Common.DbDataReader)"></xref>, which copies all rows from the supplied <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbDataReader"></xref> array to a destination table specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbDataReader"></xref> whose rows will be copied to the destination table.
A task representing the asynchronous operation.

The asynchronous version of <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.DataRow[])"></xref>, which copies all rows from the supplied <xref href="System.Data.DataRow"></xref> array to a destination table specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object.

For more information about asynchronous programming in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] Data Provider for [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)], see [Asynchronous Programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md).
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataRow"></xref> objects that will be copied to the destination table.
A task representing the asynchronous operation.
Calling <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.DataRow[])"></xref> multiple times for the same instance before task completion.

Calling <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.DataRow[])"></xref> and <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.DataRow[])"></xref> for the same instance before task completion.
The connection drops or is closed during <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.DataRow[])"></xref> execution.
Returned in the task object, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object was closed during the method execution.
Returned in the task object, there was a connection pool timeout.
Returned in the task object, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection"></xref> object is closed before method execution.
`Context Connection=true` is specified in the connection string.
Returned in the task object, any error returned by [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] that occurred while opening the connection.

The asynchronous version of <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.DataTable)"></xref>, which copies all rows in the supplied <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> to a destination table specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object.

For more information about asynchronous programming in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] Data Provider for [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)], see [Asynchronous Programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md).
A <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> whose rows will be copied to the destination table.
A task representing the asynchronous operation.
Calling <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.DataTable)"></xref> multiple times for the same instance before task completion.

Calling <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.DataTable)"></xref> and <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.DataTable)"></xref> for the same instance before task completion.
The connection drops or is closed during <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.DataTable)"></xref> execution.
Returned in the task object, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object was closed during the method execution.
Returned in the task object, there was a connection pool timeout.
Returned in the task object, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection"></xref> object is closed before method execution.
`Context Connection=true` is specified in the connection string.
Returned in the task object, any error returned by [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] that occurred while opening the connection.

The asynchronous version of <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.IDataReader)"></xref>, which copies all rows in the supplied <xref href="System.Data.IDataReader"></xref> to a destination table specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object.

For more information about asynchronous programming in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] Data Provider for [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)], see [Asynchronous Programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md).
A <xref href="System.Data.IDataReader"></xref> whose rows will be copied to the destination table.
A task representing the asynchronous operation.
Calling <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.IDataReader)"></xref> multiple times for the same instance before task completion.

Calling <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.IDataReader)"></xref> and <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.IDataReader)"></xref> for the same instance before task completion.
The connection drops or is closed during <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.IDataReader)"></xref> execution.
Returned in the task object, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object was closed during the method execution.
Returned in the task object, there was a connection pool timeout.
Returned in the task object, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection"></xref> object is closed before method execution.
The <xref href="System.Data.IDataReader"></xref> was closed before the completed <xref href="System.Threading.Tasks.Task"></xref> returned.
The <xref href="System.Data.IDataReader"></xref>'s associated connection was closed before the completed <xref href="System.Threading.Tasks.Task"></xref> returned.
`Context Connection=true` is specified in the connection string.
Returned in the task object, any error returned by [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] that occurred while opening the connection.

The asynchronous version of <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.Common.DbDataReader)"></xref>, which copies all rows from the supplied <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbDataReader"></xref> array to a destination table specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbDataReader"></xref> whose rows will be copied to the destination table.
The cancellation instruction.

A <xref href="System.Threading.CancellationToken.None"></xref> value in this parameter makes this method equivalent to <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.Common.DbDataReader)"></xref>.
Returns <xref href="System.Threading.Tasks.Task"></xref>.

The asynchronous version of <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.DataRow[])"></xref>, which copies all rows from the supplied <xref href="System.Data.DataRow"></xref> array to a destination table specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object.
The cancellation token can be used to request that the operation be abandoned before the command timeout elapses.
Exceptions will be reported via the returned Task object.

For more information about asynchronous programming in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] Data Provider for [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)], see [Asynchronous Programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md).
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataRow"></xref> objects that will be copied to the destination table.
The cancellation instruction.

A <xref href="System.Threading.CancellationToken.None"></xref> value in this parameter makes this method equivalent to <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.DataTable)"></xref>.
A task representing the asynchronous operation.
Calling <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.DataRow[])"></xref> multiple times for the same instance before task completion.

Calling <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.DataRow[])"></xref> and <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.DataRow[])"></xref> for the same instance before task completion.
The connection drops or is closed during <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.DataRow[])"></xref> execution.
Returned in the task object, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object was closed during the method execution.
Returned in the task object, there was a connection pool timeout.
Returned in the task object, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection"></xref> object is closed before method execution.
`Context Connection=true` is specified in the connection string.
Returned in the task object, any error returned by [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] that occurred while opening the connection.

The asynchronous version of <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.DataTable,System.Data.DataRowState)"></xref>, which copies only rows that match the supplied row state in the supplied <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> to a destination table specified by the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> object.

For more information about asynchronous programming in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] Data Provider for [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)], see [Asynchronous Programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md).
A <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> whose rows will be copied to the destination table.
A value from the <xref href="System.Data.DataRowState"></xref> enumeration.

Releases all resources used by the current instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy"></xref> class.
Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy>.
The `Dispose` method leaves the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> in an unusable state.

After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> was occupying.

For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
Always call `Dispose` before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy> object's `Finalize` method.
